page.title: 04AUCTION MART
page.content: The Mart which can sell about 6000 animals a week,was built in 1930 but it had to be rebuilt in 1953 after a big gale.There are four animal sales in a month and one furniture sale.The Mart has about 400 shareholders among whom Â£8000 profit is shared.They employ 3 full time workers and 10 part time workers.Prices vary depending on quality & demand.The highest priced cow was Â£1470.Mr Slater,got Â£505 each for 5 steers but he thought he could have got more for them.Sometimes the animals get frightened by the noise & strange surroundings.Some animals are sent to the Slaughter House,while others are sent south on the St.Ola or are bought for other Orkney farms. Sheep are selling for between Â£50 & Â£70.The signs for bidding are a nod ,a twitch of the cheek,winks and lifting a finger.
